episodes.title: Dr. Robert Gordon-McCutchan on Maharishi's nocturnal activities : The HIVE Part 2
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART TWO: Dr. Robert Gordon-McCutchan begins his story of Maharishi's nocturnal activities, and discusses the ethics of that behaviour. 

He was a former personal secretary and the first western person designated as a brahmachari and "deerskin carrier" for Maharishi.

Robert has a PhD from Princeton University. He has held posts at the Universities of California, New Mexico, and Oregon, with a specialty in American transcendentalism.

episodes.title: Aryeh Siegel in depth on TM scientific research integrity: The HIVE Part 9
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART NINE: In this video we interview Aryeh Siegel MSSA(MSW), a former teacher of Transcendental Meditation (TM) who left the cult and is revealing its hidden Hindu truths.

In this talk he reviews the integrity of the scientific research on TM.

Siegel was introduced to TM in 1971 when he was a graduate student at Berkeley, and became a TM teacher 1975.  He completed TM teacher training programmes in Livigno, Italy, and in Arosa, Switzerland.

episodes.title: Professor Dana Sawyer on the origins of Transcendental Meditation (TM) in India: The HIVE Part 8.
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART EIGHT: In this video we interview Dana Sawyer, Professor Emeritus of religious studies & world religions at the Maine College of Art & Design, and an adjunct professor in Asian Religions at the Chaplaincy Institute of Maine.

He and colleague Cynthia Humes were recently commissioned to write a history of the Transcendental Meditation movement for Cambridge University Press.

Professor Sawyer speaks fluent Hindi and has travelled extensively in India over many years. He is friends with literally hundreds of Dandi Swamis of the same ordained order of monks as Guru Dev, Swami Brahmananda Saraswati, the former Shankaracharya of Jyotir Math and guru of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi.

He is an author of numerous books, including "Aldous Huxley: A Biography", which Laura Huxley described as, "Out of all the biographies written about Aldous, this is the only one he would have actually liked."

Dana has lectured at the Kyoto University of Foreign Studies, Benares Hindu University, the University of Riga, Latvia, the Huntingdon Library, and at colleges and conferences throughout the United States.

episodes.title: David Laird in depth on the TM movement's finances: The HIVE Part 5
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART FIVE: This video is a presentation by David Laird on the publicly available finances of the Transcendental Meditation (TM) movement in various countries around the world. David presents the facts he has been able to investigate, and leaves you to decide for yourself what conclusions may be drawn.

David learned to meditate in 1971, worked on staff at TM world headquarters in Seelisberg, Switzerland for four months, then received TM teacher training in 1974. He was briefly one of four regional coordinators for the UK TM organisation.

In 1978 he joined The Economist  media group, and eventually became Commercial Director of The Economist Group, a £300m global media company. During a 30-year career he held various positions in sales, marketing and senior management in the UK, Europe and the USA. Under his leadership CFO Publishing, a Boston-based media company, saw revenues increase from $6m to $43m in 10 years.

More recently he served on the Peace Palace Advisory Board and has designed and written a number of publications for new Meditators, including the Perspectives newsletter which was recently reprinted.

episodes.title: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi’s personal secretary & deerskin carrier Conny Larsson: The HIVE Part 4
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART FOUR: In this video we interview Conny Larsson from Sweden, former personal secretary and deerskin carrier for Maharishi. Conny relates his experiences, with a focus in this interview on his observations of how Maharishi interacted with the young women surrounding him. 

Conny is joined by Judith Bourque, author of Robes of Silk Feet of Clay: The True Story of a Love Affair with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, the TM guru followed by the Beatles, Deepak Chopra, David Lynch, and millions more, whom we featured in Part One, and Robert Gordon-McCutchan, who also worked with Conny as a secretary and deerskin carrier for Maharishi, and was interviewed in Parts Two and Three of this series.

episodes.title: Judith Bourque & Theresa Olson on their relationships with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi: The HIVE Part 1.
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART ONE: A frank discussion with excerpts from an online Zoom session that was recorded on 20th April 2023 and includes contributions from many participants regarding their relationships with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi.

Featured speakers are:

Theresa Olson, daughter of Helena Olson PhD, one of the earliest, longtime leaders of the Transcendental Meditation (TM) Movement and the author of the book Hermit in the House, which describes the Olson family's experiences hosting Maharishi Mahesh Yogi as a guest in their home. 

Judith Bourque, Filmmaker, film editor, Holistic Therapist, and author of the book Robes of Silk Feet of Clay: The True Story of a Love Affair with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, the TM guru followed by the Beatles, Deepak Chopra, David Lynch, and millions more.

Supporting these two were Phillip Goldberg, author of 12 books including American Veda and a biography of Yogananda; Rick Archer founder and host of the Buddha at the Gas Pump online interview series; and Mark Landau, a former personal secretary and deerskin carrier for Maharishi and author of eight books.
